item.title: 2G mobile phones will no longer be operational in Singapore starting from 1 April 2017
item.description:
M1, Singtel, and StarHub will discontinue 2G services in Singapore starting April 1, 2017. This includes 2G voice calls, messaging, and data services. Users with 3G and 4G devices will not be impacted. Since the introduction of 2G service in 1994, mobile networks have progressed significantly. Singapore’s widespread 3G and 4G networks have resulted in high rates of smartphone ownership and use. The spectrum currently used for 2G will be reallocated to provide faster, more advanced 3G and 4G services to meet the growing consumer demand for mobile data and faster access speeds...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): First Contact and Two Dead Transistors
item.description:
I recently acquired a Beogram 4002 that was already being repaired but needed further troubleshooting. The unit is in good cosmetic condition with minor wear. Upon inspection, the platter motor ran when turned on, but the carriage remained static. Further investigation revealed that transistor TR20, responsible for the carriage motor control, was faulty. Replacing this component restored carriage movement. However, the carriage would move only slightly before returning to its starting position...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5501): Random Stop Issue Fixed - Defective Photo Resistor in the Spindle RPM Sensor
item.description:
A Beogram 4002 (5501) turntable, previously restored, began experiencing a problem where the OFF function would randomly activate during playback as if the button was pressed. Prior to delving into the solution, the circuit diagram is presented for reference. Transistor TR17, within the ‘Electronic Switch’ section, is responsible for initiating the turntable’s OFF function. When its base is grounded, the collector rises to approximately 18V, causing the arm to lift and return to its resting position...
